meanings.definition: A line on a map connecting points of equal thickness of a geological formation.
meanings.sent1: The isopach on the map showed where the rock layer was the same thickness.
meanings.sent2: Geologists use isopachs to understand the consistency of the earth's layers.
meanings.sent3: The isopach on the map looked like a colorful snake winding through the terrain.
meanings.sent4: The isopach acted as a ruler, measuring the depth of the rock formations.
meanings.sent5: The isopach line stood out boldly, highlighting the uniformity of the sedimentary layer.

meanings.sent1: The isopach analysis helped in understanding the rock formations better.

meanings.sent3: The isopach comparison made the geologist chuckle at the complexity of the data.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked in isopach patterns, seeing equal thickness everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The isopach concept painted a clear picture of the uniformity in the layers.
